title: 4K Resolution Update
body:
I saw that for the 7.24 patch, 4K support has been added to the game. I'm ecstatic that 4K resolution is being looked at finally, but the largest problem I have had with it is the Cursor sizing, which is the one thing that was singled out as still not supported. This is by far the biggest problem with playing in 4K, it is an extreme disadvantage when your cursor is so small. It took me until almost the end of Season 7 to notice how much it actually impacted my gameplay. I was HARDSTUCK in Gold 5 since I started using 4K resolution (last 2 seasons I have placed in Plat5/Plat 2). Once I shifted back to 1920x1080, I immediately noticed an improvement in my gameplay and started winning games again, nearly got back into Plat in a couple weeks. 

My question is why is it so difficult to fix? Is it being given up on? I haven't been able to find ANY comments from Riot regarding 4K. If someone could provide me with some insight, or a link to any previous comments from Riot, I would greatly appreciate it.

replies.body:
What I can commit to is looking into it. Converting the healthbars over into new tech allowed us to make them support 4k. Cursors and minimap icons and some other less important UI bits are still way too small as you noted.

Converting those other elements is not simple and not something we would want to take on, but there might be a stopgap solution which just allows them to scale.

> Converting those other elements is not simple and not something we would want to take on, but there might be a stopgap solution which just allows them to scale.

how about that stopgap solution you were talking about ?

Thank you for your response!

After digging further I discovered a Riot comment about not being happy with the current cursor, in all resolutions. Is it something that has been brought up to rework in the future? If so I could see that leading to the inclusion of 4K support.

> [{quoted}](name=Rayven,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=V4Nhd4GJ,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-12-06T20:11:09.867+0000)
>
> What I can commit to is looking into it. Converting the healthbars over into new tech allowed us to make them support 4k. Cursors and minimap icons and some other less important UI bits are still way too small as you noted.
> 
> Converting those other elements is not simple and not something we would want to take on, but there might be a stopgap solution which just allows them to scale.

OH SNAP. I'm super excited. I put in a ticket on this matter and this is what I had gotten back. But hearing this, is a lot more encouraging. You are my hero Rayven!!!! 

This is what the rioter Corndog said in response as of December 12th 2017.

"Unfortunately as you've said, League doesn't yet support 4k resolution. We hope to have it implemented in a later patch, but it's not something that can be discussed at this moment. As far as "why not just make the cursor bigger", it's a matter of how the UI scales as a whole. When the resolution is bigger than the game was designed for, it would be a matter of sizing everything about the game larger, not just the cursor to fit. You can change this in a way, by changing the game's video settings to play in Windowed mode at 1920 x 1080, which scales the UI to fit correctly. I understand that this makes the game smaller, but that would be the only compromise I would have to offer, aside from scaling your monitor down to 1920 x 1080, which downgrades your monitor's image quality."

The only things you can scale are the minimap to 150% and the cursor. Not the minimap icons.
To scale the minimap to 150% instead of 100 follow the instructions as described in this post: https://boards.euw.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/alpha-client-discussion-en/dM8NuXed-how-do-i-make-the-mini-map-icons-bigger?show=flat&comment=0000

You can increase the cursor size by 'changing the size of text, apps and other items' in the display settings on windows 10 to a higher setting.
Riot only makes money from spamming out champs and skins but fixing the UI for 4K doesn't make them any money so thats why they put off fixing it.
